required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ReShape Vest™ for the Treatment of Obesity (Europe)
clinical_study.official_title: An Investigative, Prospective, Non-randomized, Multi-center Study to Assess the Safety and Effectiveness of a Novel Gastric Restrictive Device, Call the ReShape Vest™, in People Who Are Obese.

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the safety and effectiveness of the LGV in treating obese subjects with a BMI of 35 kg/m2 to 55 kg/m2 who have failed one or more conservative weight-reduction alternative(s), such as supervised diet, exercise, and behavior modification program(s).

primary_outcome.description: Demonstrate at least 30% excess weight loss (%EWL)

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of Related Serious Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate safety by device and procedure-related serious adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Related Serious Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the device and procedure-related serious adverse event rate
To demonstrate the maintenance of at least 30% EWL

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With >=40% Excess Weight Loss (EWL)
secondary_outcome.description: To demonstrate at least 40% EWL for at least 40% of subjects compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With >=50% Excess Weight Loss (EWL)
secondary_outcome.description: To demonstrate at least 50% EWL for at least 35% of subjects compared to baseline

intervention.description: The Laparoscopic Gastric Vest (LGV), branded the ReShape Vest™, is a long-term, silastic, implantable system that is placed around the stomach to encompass the gastroesophageal junction to the Incisura Angularis. The main materials used to make the LGV is Implant Grade Silicone (95%) and Barium Sulfate (5%). The LGV is indicated for weight reduction for obese people with a Body Mass Index (BMI) between ≥35 kg/m2 and ≤55 kg/m2. It is indicated for use in adult patients (≥22 to ≤65 years) who have failed one or more conservative weight reduction alternative(s), such as supervised diet, exercise, and behavior modification program(s).
